definition: to take control of/to manage/to curb
variant of 管[guan3]
surname Guan

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
lit. shut your mouth, move your legs (motto for losing weight)
pinyin: guan3 zhu4 zui3 mai4 kai1 tui3

sentences.english: There must is someone who can take control of these naughty children.
sentences.chinese: 应该有人能管住这些淘气的孩子。

sentences.english: I am a single mother and try to keep an eye on him .
sentences.chinese: 我是一个单身妈妈，并且努力管住我的孩子。

sentences.english: Cuddy : I get your point, I'll be more careful with my tongue in the future.
sentences.chinese: 我明白你意思了，我以后会更小心的管住“舌头”的。

sentences.english: Yes you do care because they may have your lunch.
sentences.chinese: 你一定要关心，他们管住你的饭碗的。

sentences.english: You'd better get your dog under control.
I can manage these naughty boys.
sentences.chinese: 我能管住这些淘气的男孩子。

sentences.english: Can you a standing ovation a third camp?Just was trained by me, the heart spirit was tall.
sentences.chinese: 你能管住第三营么？刚被我训练过，心气可高。

sentences.english: Keep your money in your wallet, and don’t get lazy.
sentences.chinese: 管住您的钱包，不要偷懒。

sentences.english: You must curb your daughter when you are in church.
sentences.chinese: 你在教堂时必须管住你的女儿。

sentences.english: The key to adjusting the general supply and demand is to control currency volume.
sentences.chinese: 而需求管理的关键又在于管住货币。

definition: lit. to open a water source and reduce outflow (idiom); to increase income and save on spending/to broaden the sources of income and economize on expenditure
to tether/to tie up/(fig.) to restrict/to keep a hold on
to control flow/to choke/weir valve/a throttle/a choke
to control/to restrict/to moderate/to temper/moderation/sobriety/to administer
to have no right or ability to interfere in sth/it's none of your business!
taking or eating more than one's due (idiom); greedy and selfish
(coll.) to learn one's lesson/to have enough brains to learn from one's mistakes
lit. drink the northwest wind (idiom); cold and hungry
lit. to hold a bowl of water level (idiom)/fig. to be impartial
to drop a bad habit
to act recklessly/to mess around
self-discipline/self-regulation/autonomy (ethics)/autonomic (physiology)
to treat only the symptoms but not the root cause
to talk
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
to go hungry/to starve
